title: World History - Beginner
description: Basic world history covering major events and civilizations

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington was the first President of the United States, serving from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan in September.

questions.question: Which ancient wonder of the world was located in Egypt?
questions.explanation: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only ancient wonder still standing today.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa during the Italian Renaissance.

questions.question: Which empire was ruled by Julius Caesar?
questions.explanation: Julius Caesar was a Roman general and dictator of the Roman Empire.

questions.question: In which year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, marking the beginning of German reunification.

questions.question: Which explorer is credited with discovering the Americas?
questions.explanation: Christopher Columbus is credited with the European discovery of the Americas in 1492.

questions.question: What was the name of the ship on which Charles Darwin made his famous voyage?
questions.explanation: Charles Darwin sailed on HMS Beagle from 1831 to 1836, which inspired his theory of evolution.

questions.question: Which country gifted the Statue of Liberty to the United States?
questions.explanation: France gifted the Statue of Liberty to the United States in 1886 as a symbol of freedom and democracy.

questions.question: Who was the famous queen of ancient Egypt known for her beauty?
questions.explanation: Cleopatra VII was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt, known for her intelligence and beauty.
